data.meaning_mnemonic:
By a <radical>tree</radical>, there's a <radical>sheep</radical> in the <radical>water</radical> with a <kanji>formal name ender</kanji>. That means everyone calls him Sheep-sama. No one calls him just "Sheep," since he's kind of a big deal. He's actually like sheep royalty. When he's not in his castle, Sheep-sama enjoys playing in the water by the trees.

This can also mean <kanji>manner</kanji>, as in your manner of doing things. I guess someone with a formal name ender has a different manner of doing things.
data.meaning_hint: Imagine what Sheep-sama must have done to become such important and distinguished sheep royalty. Some pretty amazing things, probably, especially for a sheep.
data.reading_mnemonic: This sheep with the <kanji>formal name ender</kanji> only likes to play outside in the water during the <reading>summer</reading> (さま). Summer is the best season for this fancy sheep. The other seasons just can't compare.
data.reading_hint: Imagine playing in the water with Sheep-sama in the summer. It's crazy hot outside in the summer, so going in the water feels nice. Imagine the coolness of the refreshing water envelop your body.
